title: Vector Algebra â€“ Difficult Level
description: Answer all questions. Each carries 1 mark. These questions require detailed calculation or reasoning.

questions.title: A rectangular sheet ABCD is folded in such a way that vertex A meets vertex C, thereby forming a line PQ. Assuming AB = 3 and BC = 4, find PQ. Note that AP = PC and AQ = QC.

In the figure, $\angle ABC = \frac{\pi}{2}$ and $AD = DE = EB$.

Find the ratio of the area of triangle $ADC$ to that of triangle $CDB$.
DRQP is a small square of side $a$ in the corner of a big square ABCD of side $A$ . What is the ratio of the area of the quadrilateral PBRQ to that of the square ABCD, given $$\frac{A}{a}=3$$ ?
